name: duti
description: Select default apps for documents and URL schemes on macOS

repo.name: duti
repo.description: A command-line tool to select default applications for document types and URL schemes on Mac OS X

readme.summary: Well-structured README with excellent clarity and examples, but lacks configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section despite acknowledgment that the project is unsupported, and configuration options (settings file format, plist structure) are mentioned but not documented

injection_risks.description: The function fsethandler() uses fgets() to read input from a file, which can lead to buffer overflow if the line is too long.
The function psethandler() uses CFDictionaryGetValue() to retrieve values from a plist, but does not check for NULL returns, which can lead to crashes or unexpected behavior.

critical_findings: Lack of input validation in fsethandler() and psethandler()
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential buffer overflows and lack of input validation, but does not appear to have any critical vulnerabilities that would allow for remote exploitation.

common_complaints: Darwin/macOS version compatibility - multiple unresolved issues across different macOS versions (darwin22, darwin23, darwin24)
Lack of maintenance and active development - users explicitly questioning if project is abandoned
Missing features and functionality - feature requests without responses
Long-standing unresolved bugs dating back years
sentiment.summary: The duti project shows severe abandonment signals with multiple unresolved compatibility issues spanning years, zero maintainer engagement, and explicit community concerns about the project's maintenance status.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides helpful and clear responses, is welcoming to new contributors, but occasionally displays a hint of frustration with repeated or basic questions.

concerns: No commits for over 2.5 years (since July 2023)
27 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicates no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows no active development
No active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release suggests lack of version management
maintenance.summary: This package is effectively abandoned with no maintenance activity for over 2.5 years and mounting unresolved issues.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides useful examples, but lacks comprehensive installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: no commits in the past 6 months
Security: Potential buffer overflow in fsethandler()
Security: Lack of input validation in fsethandler() and psethandler()
highlights: 10 contributors active in the past 6 months
